business.headline: Urban Company IPO open for bidding today: Should you invest as GMP doubles?Ahead of the public subscription, Urban Company raised Rs 854 crore from anchor investors. Notable institutions participating in the anchor round included Government Pension Fund Global, Nomura Funds Ireland, etc.

Oracle cuts over 100 jobs in India as AI reshapes workforceOracle, which employs around 30,000 people in India, reported a revenue of Rs 20,459 crore in the year ended March 2024, a 20% jump from the previous year.

Backpacking on a budget: Smart forex tips for young travellersFor young backpackers, every rupee counts. While cheap flights and hostels often top the checklist, the way you manage foreign exchange could quietly decide whether your trip stays on budget, or slips into overspending.

Hyderabad on track to become a global tech hub: D Sridhar BabuHyderabad is aiming to become a global technology hub, focusing on innovation, start-ups, and talent development. At the India Today Conclave South 2025, D Sridhar Babu, Minister for IT, E&C, Industries & Commerce, outlined the city's vision.
Sensex ends 314 points higher, Nifty above 24,850; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 314.02 points to close at 81,101.32, while the NSE Nifty50 added 95.45 points to end at 24,868.60.

Karisma Kapoor's children vs stepmother Priya in lawsuit over Sunjay Kapur's willSunjay Kapur's children, identified as the legal heirs, have filed a suit in Delhi High Court seeking partition of the estate, rendition of accounts, and a permanent injunction

Hyderabad aims to become a global technology hub, says D Sridhar BabuHyderabad, according to  D Sridhar Babu, is positioning itself as a global technology and innovation hub, with a strong focus on AI, start-ups, industry, and skill development, while aiming to balance economic growth with social welfare.

Ericsson lays off 100 Canadian employees amid global restructuringEricsson has confirmed that about 100 of its Canadian staff will lose their jobs as the company continues to restructure its workforce worldwide.
How can ease of business be improved in India's real estate sector?

The PF problem: Why so many employees struggle to access their own moneyEvery month, employees across India save a part of their salary in the Provident Fund. But system errors, bureaucratic delays, and glitches mean that for millions, claiming their own PF money has become a frustrating challenge.

How can India achieve affordable housing? Tata Realty CEO explainsSanjay Dutt, Managing Director and CEO of Tata Realty & Infrastructure Ltd, spoke about how India can work towards making affordable housing more accessible and practical.

From Agarwals to Patels: Which surnames rule India's richest family businesses?Behind India's richest family businesses lies an interesting pattern, certain surnames appear again and again. The Hurun India Rich List 2025 reveals which surnames dominate this legacy of wealth, with Agarwals, Guptas and Jains leading the pack.

entertainment.headline: Akshay Kumar consoles fan as she surprises him with handmade gift on birthdayAkshay Kumar celebrated his 58th birthday by expressing gratitude to fans and receiving a touching gift from a young admirer. He kissed the young fan on her forehead, who was in tears seeing him.

Lokah crosses Rs 200 crore globally, becomes 4th highest grosser in Malayalam'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra', India and Malayalam cinema's first female superhero film, surpassed Rs 200 crore globally. The film, starring Kalyani Priyadarshan, is the fourth-highest grosser in Mollywood.

Tanya Mittal asks Premanand Maharaj, why she's not happy, his reply goes viralTanya Mittal's old video about seeking happiness during her visit to Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan has emerged online. This comes amid her entry in Salman Khan-hosted 'Bigg Boss 19'.

Steven Spielberg praises Leonardo Dicaprio's One Battle After Another: Insane filmDirector Paul Thomas Anderson's 'One Battle After Another' received high praise in its first reviews. Director Steven Spielberg and other critics praised the unique blend of absurdist comedy and intense storytelling.

Inside Bigg Boss Telugu Season 9: 9 celebs, 6 commoners, owners vs tenants format'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' premiered on September 7, 2025, bringing together nine celebrities and six commoners under the new 'Owners vs Tenants' format. The season divides the house into separate groups, setting the stage for clashes and drama as the contestants navigate the competition.

Kalyani Priyadarshan on Lokah's success: Proud to be India's 1st female superheroWith 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra' drawing acclaim, Kalyani Priyadarshan is being hailed for breaking new ground as India's first female superhero. In an exclusive conversation, the actor shared how she feels about her new title.

Prajakta Koli cancels Nepal travel plan amid protests, expresses solidarityActor-Youtuber Prajakta Koli cancelled her Nepal travel plans amid Gen-Z protests, expressing concern for those affected by the unrest and a social media ban.

Saba Azad, Imaad Shah on their bond after breakup: We became less judgmentalActors Saba Azad and Imaad Shah recently opened up on their breakup and the evolution of their relationship. They stated that their bond has transformed into a strong, family-like friendship with mutual support and understanding.

Actor Saiyami Kher feels films shape beliefs, inspire social change'Special Ops 2' actor Saiyami Kher, in an interview with IndiaToday.in, spoke about playing a spy and performing combat sequences. She also reflected on portraying strong characters on-screen, inspirational Hindi films and the role of sports in her life.

Actor Saloni Gaur feels excessive censorship limits satire and artActor-comedian Saloni Gaur, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, expressed her views on censorship, mental health, digital detox and more. She was recently seen in the slice-of-life series 'Lafangey'.

Ghatiya aurat, fake shakal: Aahana and Bali's explosive fight rock Rise & FallActor Aahana Kumra and influencer Bali engaged in a verbal clash during the nomination task on 'Rise & Fall.' Both contestants exchanged personal insults and called each other fake.

Catherine Zeta-Jones watches SRK's Om Shanti Om at US Open, fans praise her tasteActor Catherine Zeta-Jones shared her fondness for Shah Rukh Khan's 'Om Shanti Om'. The actor enjoyed watching the iconic Bollywood film while waitig for US Open.

Shwetha Menon pushes for better work conditions for women, reflects on fixed hoursActor Shwetha Menon, the first woman president of AMMA, stressed the need for fixed working hours for women in cinema at India Today South Conclave 2025. Drawing from her own pregnancy shoots, she highlighted how communication, support systems, and fear of career setbacks continue to shape women's struggles in the film industry.

Shwetha Menon on obscenity case: Was shattered, then I became a fiery tigressAt the India Today Conclave South 2025, actor Shwetha Menon reacted to the FIR filed against her while she was contesting for the president of Association of Malayalam Movie Artistes (AMMA).

Actor Shwetha Menon discusses being 1st woman leader of AMMA, safe working spacesActor Shwetha Menon took charge as the first female president of the Association of Malayalam Movie Artists (AMMA), highlighting key changes in the organisation post-Covid. She addressed challenges including legal cases and stressed communication and content over gender biases.

Cooking doesn't define a woman - lesson 101 from Kunickaa-Tanya's BB 19 clashThe Kunickaa Sadanand vs Tanya Mittal clash in 'Bigg Boss 19' isn't just another kitchen fight, it shines a harsh light on how women empowerment is still misunderstood. Cooking doesn't define a woman, and the explosive debate proves why empowerment is about freedom of choice, not outdated gender roles.

Dhanashree: Getting movie offers for my talent, not because of what happenedChoreographer Dhanashree Verma opened up about getting multiple offers for films in the recent episode of 'Rise & Fall.' She said she is being offered films because of her talent and not what happened in her personal life. Dhanashree and cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal got divorced in March 2025.

Punjab floods: Salman's Being Human foundation sends boats, to adopt villagesActor Salman Khan's Being Human foundation has joined the rescue and relief work as Punjab faces floods. The foundation has sent five boats to flood-affected areas. It has also planned to adopt flood-hit border villages near Husainiwala.

Is Rise & Fall what Bigg Boss once used to be?'Rise & Fall' debuts as a fresh reality show focusing on power and social divides. Here's a look at how this show will remind you what 'Bigg Boss' used to be.

general news.headline: Likewise: PM Modi responds to Trump's 'looking forward to speak' postThe positive exchange between PM Modi and US President Donald Trump comes against the backdrop of Washington's punitive 50 per cent tariffs on New Delhi over Russian oil imports roiling bilateral ties.

Will speak to good friend Modi: Trump says talks on US-India trade barriers onAfter months of sharp warnings over Russian oil imports, US President Donald Trump has now said that the trade talks with India are progressing and predicts a mutually beneficial outcome in the coming weeks.

Apple launches iPhone 17 Pro, Pro Max in India with 48MP triple camera and A19 Pro chip: DetailsBilled as the most powerful iPhones ever created, the new Pro lineup introduces a redesigned camera system, fast A19 Pro chip, and the longest-ever battery life on an iPhone.

The Great Nicobar Project aims to create India's Hong Kong. Why the row?India's Rs 72,000-crore Great Nicobar Project aims to build a transshipment port, airport, power plant, and township on the far-away Great Nicobar Island. Congress leader Sonia Gandhi's criticism of the project as "ill-conceived policymaking" sparked a political slugfest. So, what exactly is India's Hong Kong-like Great Nicobar Project, and how do ecological concerns weigh against strategic and economic gains?

996 is latest work culture craze in Silicon Valley, 5-day week can go take a hikeIt seems work culture in Silicon Valley tech companies is changing, largely driven by startups and teams that hustle. Once famed for relaxed work in companies like Google and Microsoft, the town is now host to work craze called 996, which means working from 9am to 9pm and six days a week.

Nepal Gen Z Protest Live: Army chief holds midnight talks with protesters as unrest continuesNepal descended into political turmoil on Tuesday after Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli resigned, as Gen Z-led demonstrations intensified across Kathmandu and other regions. Protesters stormed government buildings, including Parliament and the Prime Minister's Office, and set ablaze the private residences of President Ram Chandra Poudel, Oli, and several former premiers. In response to the escalating crisis, the Nepal Army and top security officials jointly appealed for calm, urging dialogue as the only path to restore order. The Army vowed to safeguard the country's sovereignty, independence, and the lives and property of its citizens while closely monitoring the Gen Z-led movement.

CP Radhakrishnan is Vice-President, Sudershan Reddy's tally shows cracks in OppositionNDA candidate CP Radhakrishnan is the 15th Vice President of India, defeating his rival INDIA bloc candidate B Sudershan Reddy (300) by 452 to 300 votes.

Trump urges EU to impose 100% tariffs on India, China to pressure Russia: ReportDonald Trump urged the EU to impose 100 per cent tariffs on China and India, pressing for a joint transatlantic effort to cut Russia's oil revenues and intensify economic pressure on Vladimir Putin.

Did Suryakumar snub handshake with Pakistan captain? Viral clip clears airAsia Cup 2025: Suryakumar Yadav and Salman Ali Agha grabbed the spotlight at the captains' meet in Dubai on Tuesday, as speculation over the two skipping a handshake went viral on social media.

Changing the suicide narrative: Why mental health is everyone's businessSuicide rates in India highlight urgent need to change harmful narratives. Greater awareness and support systems can help prevent these avoidable deaths.

US says it notified Qatar about Israeli strike, Doha says call came after attackThe Trump administration confirmed it was notified in advance of Israel's strike on Hamas negotiators in Doha but stressed it did not support the move, warning it undermines peace efforts with Qatar.

Poland scrambles jets, shuts airports over reports of Russian drones in airspaceReports of Russian drones in its territory caused a panic in Poland, with authorities shutting down Warsaw airport and scrambling fighter jets to counter the threat.

Video: Sweden's Health Minister collapses during press meet soon after appointmentSweden's newly appointed Health Minister, Elisabet Lann, collapsed during a live press conference on Tuesday. Lann later returned, explaining the collapse was due to a "blood sugar drop."

US must be careful not to push PM Modi closer to China, says ex-CIA chiefFormer CIA Director William Burns warned that Trump's India policy could push PM Modi closer to China's Xi, calling it a serious concern during a discussion on US global leadership.

Shreyas Iyer's aggressive demeanour under scrutiny? Former spinner speaks outShreyas Iyer's exclusion from India's Asia Cup squad has left many cricket enthusiasts puzzled. Former spinner Maninder Singh supports Iyer's leadership qualities and questions the selection decisions.

Apple launches iPhone Air, says thinnest iPhone ever made: See price, featuresThe term "Air" is not new to Apple. The suffix made its debut with the MacBook in 2008 with the scene of the late Steve Jobs pulling it out of an envelope, still iconic and one to beat at tech keynote events. Recently, the iPad got the Air update and now, finally, it is coming to the iPhone.

Why North West's finger piercing is the most viral (and questionable) trend RNIf North West's dermal finger piercing controversy has caught your attention and left you curious, here's your complete guide to this trending body jewellery.

Oli, India and the curious timing of Nepal protestsThe massive protests in Nepal in which 20 people have been killed came ahead of PM KP Sharma Oli's planned trip to India and after his return from China. India's immediate neighbourhood has become a playground of diverse external forces. Though the Gen Z protests seem to be spontaneous, they come amid China-US tug-of-war and can be hijacked, warn experts.

Pune techie, wife assaulted inside theatre for objecting to movie spoilersA software engineer and his wife were assaulted by another couple sitting behind them after they objected to movie spoilers during screening of The Conjuring: Last Rites.

Watch: Dejected Gukesh storms out of hall after 2nd straight Grand Swiss lossWorld Champion D Gukesh stormed out of the Samarkand playing hall after losing to Nikolas Theodorou, visibly frustrated. He did not speak to interviewers or fans, leaving immediately after the match without engaging with anyone.

Akshay Kumar consoles fan as she surprises him with handmade gift on birthdayAkshay Kumar celebrated his 58th birthday by expressing gratitude to fans and receiving a touching gift from a young admirer. He kissed the young fan on her forehead, who was in tears seeing him.

Noida woman forcibly converted to Islam, married off in Chennai; 3 arrestedA Noida woman, mother of a six-year-old, was allegedly forced into Islam by Raja Mian alias Ehsan and his family, renamed and married off through a forged nikahnama.

US house committee releases Epstein birthday book with Clinton, Trump notesA US house committee released Jeffrey Epstein's 2003 birthday book featuring messages attributed to Bill Clinton, Donald Trump, Alan Dershowitz, and business leaders, mixing lighthearted wishes with crude remarks and explicit imagery.

Canada rejects 80% Indian student visas in 2025, top choice status fallsCanada, once a top destination for study-abroad aspirants, rejected 80% of visa applications for Indian students in 2025, the highest in a decade. Barely 9% of Indian study abroad aspirants now see it as the top choice. With growing uncertainty and mounting challenges, what does studying in Canada look like now, and what new study-abroad dreams are Indian students embracing?

sports.headline: Kuldeep Yadav might play in the Asia Cup: Ex-spinnerKuldeep Yadav did not play a single match in India's Test series against England. Will Kuldeep Yadav feature in India's playing XI in Asia Cup 2025?

IND v UAE preview: Suryakumar Yadav's India out to justify favourites tagThe Asia Cup opens with India expected to set the tone. The defending world champions will be looking to live up to the billing of outright favourites. The UAE, meanwhile, chase pride in a rare shot against cricket's powerhouse.

Holger Rune claps back after Kalinskaya claims he slid into her DMs 10 timesDanish tennis star Holger Rune has responded to Anna Kalinskaya's claims of unwanted advances. He claimed cultural misunderstandings and said he didn't ask her out.

Ashwin slams lack of competition in Asia Cup, suggests inclusion of India AFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has criticised the Asia Cup 2025 for its lack of competitive teams. He suggested including African sides or India A to raise the tournament's standard ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup.

Pakistan doing really well without Babar and Rizwan: Salman AghaPakistan cricket team is rebuilding under captain Salman Ali Agha. Ahead of the their opening match of the tournament, Salman Agha said that they are playing to win the Asia Cup trophy.

Shreyas Iyer's aggressive demeanour under scrutiny? Former spinner speaks outShreyas Iyer's exclusion from India's Asia Cup squad has left many cricket enthusiasts puzzled. Former spinner Maninder Singh supports Iyer's leadership qualities and questions the selection decisions.

Asia Cup: Spoilt for choices, Rashid Khan says leading Afghanistan a tough jobAfghanistan captain Rashid Khan spoke about the challenge of managing the rich spin arsenal of his team. Afghanistan began their Asia Cup 2025 campaign with a massive 94-run win over Hong Kong as they left out Mujeeb ur Rehman.

Asia Cup 2025: Dark horses Afghanistan crush Hong Kong to begin campaign in styleAfghanistan got their Asia Cup 2025 campaign off to a phenomenal start as they crushed Hong Kong by 94 runs in the tournament opener. Sediqullah Atal top-scored for his team with his unbeaten innings of 73* (52).

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
